meanings.definition: Relating to rubrics or rules for conducting a religious service.
meanings.sent1: The rubrical guidelines for the ceremony were strictly followed.
meanings.sent2: The priest referred to the rubrical instructions during the service.
meanings.sent3: The choir members playfully debated the rubrical requirements for the hymns.
meanings.sent4: Her adherence to the rubrical traditions was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The rubrical details added a sense of solemnity to the occasion.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to rubrics or instructions for a ceremony or ritual.
meanings.sent1: Following the rubrical steps, the ceremony proceeded smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The rubrical symbols were carefully arranged on the altar.
meanings.sent3: The students comically mixed up the rubrical order of the ritual.
meanings.sent4: His movements were precise, like a rubrical dance.
meanings.sent5: The rubrical decor set the perfect mood for the event.
